title: Education and Experience
text:
I graduated with honors from the University of Michigan in 2020 majoring in neuroscience. After earning my B.S. degree, I spent the next year abroad working with English teachers in elementary and middle schools to improve English literacy and comprehension. I returned to the US in 2021, where I proceeded to work as a lab manager in the Yin lab at the University of Michigan. After two years, I started a PhD program at Case Western Reserve University. I am currently a second year student working in Dr. Xin Qi’s lab.
Thanks for exploring my website!

title: Welcome to my website!
text:
Welcome to my website!
My name is Sarah Cooke, and I am a second year neuroscience PhD student studying at Case Western Reserve University in Dr. Xin Qi’s lab. My research focuses on the role of mitochondrial dysfunction in amyotrophic lateral sclerosis (ALS). Outside of lab, I enjoy spending time with my sister and my chaotic but loving orange cat Regulus.
